page.title: 02 SALTWOOD VILLAGE.
page.content: Saltwood is by far the largest dwelling area of the block.Parts of it are mentioned in the Domesday Book.The castle,in the next block,is a possible site of a Saxon fortress dating from C400.The register of the parish church of S.S.Peter & Paul dates from C14. It is a pleasant,picturesque village originally built around the present village green but now expanded into a much wider area of expensive housing. There is a regular bus service and it is close to the railway-station and the motorway. The amenities and facilities are good.It has a garage,a pub"The Castle",a Post-Office,two General Stores,a butchers and a hairdressers. There are also two nearby farm-shops. See page 16 for more detail.
